Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTimon
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, beautiful lobby and great rooms! Hotel is located 15/20 minutes walk north of Taksim square and there is alot of activity and shops around the hotel. Don't understand the negativ reviews of no restaurants in the area - nor that there should be prostitudes hanging in the streets next to the hotel... In order to go to Sultanahmet and all the big tourist-atractions such as the blue mosque, aya sofia etc you need to take a taxi (20 LIRA with an honest taxidriver) or go by metro/tram. The metro system doesn't cover the whole city so you need to change two times before you reach Sultanahmet (cost 6 LIRA). However the best and fastest way to get around is by Dolmus, which are small buses (also called metro-bus in Istanbul). This is a speedy hop-on hop-off bus that stops at several stations. It can be tricky to get the right one but people are friendly and asked us if we needed help. Just outside is for example a station which has Besiktas as endstation, and from there you can take the ferry to the Asian side! The dolmus cost only 1,75 LIRA and is also fun to ride! 5 minutes walk from a smaller street with several nice restaurant and I think we were the only tourists there... Hotelstaff was friendly and helped us everyday with all our questions. Only negative was when we asked for restaurant recomendations and specificly asked for their personal favorites! The man in the frontdesk then hands us a businesscard for a restaurant he described as "very good, I have sent 5000 persons there" but when we asked how much a maindish was he refused to answer and after we pushed him said "it depends on how much you drink..." Well... we didn't go there. Room was fantastic and had just the space we needed. everything looked great and was well decorated. Felt like a livingroom. Anything negative? Bathtub was slow to drain the water and the spare-toilet role we found in a locker wasn't replaced all weekend... We red other reviews about the noisy street and we asked for a room not facing the street, but still we could hear the cars and the honking all night. (but, Istanbul is a huge city and there are cars and people everywhere so I think it's hard to avoid) Breakfast was good but felt boring the third day (yohgurt, egg, fresh fruit, and bread) and I could really use some sausage or omelette. We chose this hotel to aviod the most tourist-streets and we liked that. You cant walk to the big attractions but it's quite fast to go there by dolmus/taxi. Taksim sqaure and all the bars around there isn't that far away though. We are very satisfied with our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: JD42_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a corner suite, very nice and well appointed rooms. Comfortable bed. As noted in other rooms, breakfast was a little spartan perhaps. Staff were polite and very helpful, suggested a great restaurant nearby. As it happens, I left a few things behind in my room, and the staff were fantastic in locating the items and getting them sent on. Great location, would definitely stay there again given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsND
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for 4 nights at the start of the month. We were in room 801 which has a separate sitting room, bedroom and bathroom. All of the rooms were well decorated, the bathroom was fabulous with a shower over bath, a walk in shower and a really deep bath. The bed was at least king size and there was plenty of storage room for your belongings in the bedroom. There was a well stocked mini bar in the room prices can be quite expensive as mini bars usually are. All the staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful, they were more than happy to help whenever they could. Gym is quite small, but it was never busy while I was there so more than enough equipment for a decent workout. Breakfast was ok it was continental breakfast and the only cooked food available was omlettes which would be made for you if requested. I would certainly recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet all expectations”
Reviews.Author: poha8990
Reviews.Content: We were 5 friends staying here on a weekend trip. Chose the hotel as the only member of design hotels of the world in Istanbul. The decoration is nice and suited our Scandinavian taste. However, as another reviewer wrote, the hotel lacks esprit. It seems like there is no dedication to the concept, the concept by the Italian designers is maintained but without any feeling. This leaves you with a cold feeling at times. Take the lobby for example: It is minimalistic and clean, but I never saw any guests hanging around there, the bar was never staffed but seemed like more of a must have. The lobby is in no way cozy. We stayed in two floor suites, providing us with a lot of space. I must praise the generosity of the hotel for letting our 5th person stay in a sofa-bed free of charge - though the website said max occupancy 2 persons. Rooms are clean and the bed of good quality. The street below is quite busy, so sleeping with the windows/french doors open was not really an option. The espresso machine provided us with better coffee than the one at breakfast, but I was a bit surprised to be charged for the consumption of Nespresso capsules at check-out, though the sum was moderate. Breakfast was good but not very assorted. You could have eggs prepared the way you wanted them. The breakfast area is calm and relaxing, coffee was served at the table. We used the sauna, located in basement together with the gym. The area was modern and the sauna is spacious enough to host 10 people. It felt like the area was not frequently used. Free wifi in the lobby and breakfast area was great, a pity there was no wifi in the rooms. Locationwise, I thought the surrounding streets would be more interesting, now it felt like a stretch to walk down to the Taksim square. I guess it is preferable to stay south of Taksim in the heart of Beyoglu if you visit Istanbul as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location... great hotel”
Reviews.Author: micmm
Reviews.Content: Great service at the front desk, and the location was close to perfect for me and my wife. It is very close from the shopping streets (5 min walk) and the cool cafe's and it talkes 25-35 to the historic center with Metro & tram. You can do it a little faster with Taxi, depending on traffic... Negative: Very small selection for breakfast... Go to the cafe's or bakeries close by!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, pleasant atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: paolamz
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and received a very good service. Before my arrival, I asked for a silent room: they up-grated my standard room â€“ for free - to a better one located on the 7th floor (higher floor, quite far from the noise of the traffic). The hotel is elegant and modern, offers a nice atmosphere and is centrally located. The restaurant is very good, for dinner and for breakfast as well. The staff is efficient, kind and ready to help. Itâ€™s a pity the hotel doesnâ€™t offer a free Wi-fi connection in the rooms, but only in the lobby and restaurant. The second element I would improve is the curtains in the room: they are very thin and you can see the street light even during the night. Anyway, my overall opinion on this hotel is very good and would come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Service”
Reviews.Author: amikacin
Reviews.Content: I've spent 5 nights in this hotel. This is a great hotel, with excellent staff, always ready to help with your needs. The location is perfect for attending a conference, but it is a little bit away from the more touristic areas. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms and helpful front desk, but don't leave valuables in room!”
Reviews.Author: MiaTiger
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on Wallpaper Guide inclusion. The location is alright although Taxi drivers hadn't a clue! We cannot fault the front desk, very helpful with everything including the source of the amazing Turkish Delights. We mark this Hotel down because â‚¬â‚¬ were stolen from our room, presumably by a cleaner, who then placed a 'do not clean' sign on our door to conceal the incident. Overall a good hotel, just be very careful.

Reviews.Title: “Real design quality”
Reviews.Author: demeter666
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in the Bosphorus Suite of The Bentley Hotel. The last time was around 4 years ago and I am pleased to say not much had changed. I returned as this is one of my favourite hotel rooms anywhere and I have travelled extensively. The hotel was designed by Piero Lissoni who is a world class product and interior designer. (We own some of his furniture) His approach is that of sophisticated, slightly understated elegant modernity. This is not brash boutique style that looks like an adolescentâ€™s dream of a night club; it is where you would be happy to live. The hotel itself is modestly sized so there are not a huge number of public facilities such as a pool or spa; it is really about the accommodation. The lobby is slightly ascetic but tranquil and serene. The location is Harbiye, a busy, mixed residential/commercial neighbourhood that is adjacent to Nisantasi, a polished, glamorous smart shopping area that is a joyous relief after the crazy clamour of the older parts of town. Also of note is the Dolmus station that is literally across the road giving rapid and cheap access to the waterfront at Besiktas and the ferries that depart from there regularly. I recommend the 20 minute hop over to Kadikoy, the cultural centre of the Asian side of the city. The suite sits on top of the hotel with full height glazing looking out in one direction to the Bosphorus and towards the Istanbul conurbation in the other. A large paved balcony wraps around the suite with two access doors. There is also an outdoor shower. Internally the floor finishes are oak in the sitting room, carpet in the bedroom and stone in the bathroom. There is an obvious intelligence about all of the design choices that have been made, both from a functional and aesthetic point of view. This is so rare in hotels where compromise tends to be the norm. A calm palette of rich browns and oatmeals is carried throughout with colour mostly deriving from the materials themselves. The soundproofing is excellent. Facilities include a bar/kitchen with 2 mini fridges, a sink and an espresso machine. There is a dining area and a sitting room with CD/radio and T.V. with a good selection of English language channels. The totally separate bedroom has its own T.V. The bathroom is equipped with a Jacuzzi bathtub which we put to full use twice a day. It also has a multi nozzle shower cubicle. Robes and slippers are of good quality. The A/C is first class. I canâ€™t comment on the standard rooms as I havenâ€™t seen them but I would imagine that the design ethos is carried through. One measure I have of the hotels that I stay in is how long it takes for Room Service to bring ice, an item that is not chargeable. The Bentley was consistently under 5 minutes, sometimes quicker. Bravo! Elsewhere I have waited up to 45 minutes. Breakfast is slightly underwhelming and doesnâ€™t change from day to day although they are happy to cook omelettes and scramble eggs but you have to know to ask. There doesnâ€™t seem to be a menu. On our first visit the Concierge was exceptional but second time around he had left but the desk staff were pleasant and competent save for one unfortunate restaurant recommendation (Park Fora â€“ do not go there!) There are some excellent restaurants within walking distance. The most notable would be Borsa (10 minutes walk through the park) and Kosebasi (again 10 minutes) in Nisantasi. Although the rack rates are quite high I have found the Bentley willing to negotiate and end up at a price that I think represents excellent value for money. I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “far away from the tourist attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Chetan J
Reviews.Content: We had booked Tom Tom Suites but were given Bentley Hotel instead by our travel agent due to non-availability of the former. We had already seen the location on the map and knew that it was not the area we wanted to stay in, but we let our agent make the call. We wanted a smaller boutique property instead of the Hiltons etc. Hotel - It is a modern hotel with a classy look. It is located on a main street about 20-30 minute walk away from Taksim square one of the main squares of Istanbul's more modern area on the European side. There is nothing much of interest in the vicinity of the hotel. Taksim is 30 mins. walk away, Dolmabache Palace is also a 30 mins. walk downhill from the hotel. Only the Nisantasi shopping area is close to the hotel - 5 minutes walk away. The street close to the hotel is not very well lit at night & makes you slightly uncomfortable if you are coming from the hustle & bustle & nightlife of taksim / istikal cadessi. Rooms - Clean, large rooms but not very quiet. There was constant noise in the hallway of other guests & staff and it somehow made it to the room. You can even hear the sound of the toilet flush of the neighbouring rooms in your own room and thats definitely not a good feeling. Our A/c also used to make a lot of noise if we raised the air flow level to maximum, so we had to keep it at a low level. There is Free wifi in the lobby & the mezannine restaurant, but no wifi in the rooms. But they do have a LAN cable in the room for internet if you have your laptop. There is a small gym & a sauna room in the basement of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended. Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: rtb_stl
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed 7 nights here and would highly recommend the hotel. The staff is excellent. They made several solid recommendations, assisted with transportation, and generally helped us with every request we had. It's a very short walk to NiÅŸantaÅŸÄ± and manageable (downhill) walk to Ä°stiklal Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “not quite a design hotel”
Reviews.Author: evuh_l
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in a number of design hotels but I dont think bentley qualifies as one. stayed in SAS radisson in orktakoy and that in my opinion- is a designer hotel. nevertheless- great bed sheets. really comfy and I enjoyed sleeping in late great area too. very near nisantasi

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, Modern, Design Hotel...Good for 20/30 Year Olds”
Reviews.Author: howardde
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Istanbul and the lovely Bentley Hotel. We booked a corner room, which is a step up from the standard room, but a step down from their suites. It is basically an extra large room with floor to ceiling windows covering the whole corner (provided a ton of light). The room was very modern, very clean and really tasteful (assuming you like W Hotel style decor). The bathroom, small, but nicely laid out, was floor to ceiling Travertine (I'm guessing) with Dorn Bracht plumbing fixtures. The bed was probably the best part...really soft sheets with a nice down comforter (something we didn't experience elsewhere in Turkey). We had a lovely fruit bowl and Turkish Delights waiting for us in the room when we checked in. The lobby was great, with a nice bar that is only staffed when you ask for a drink (they then send a bartender out). The front desk staff was incredibly accomodating (maybe they have read the other reviews here that have panned it in the past). They booked reservations for us, made recommendations and were very friendly. Breakfast was good, although it's not a large selection (cheeses, meats, yogurts, cereal and fresh fruit...no eggs made to order, etc.). My negatives were limited: our television was an old cheap 13" bulky tube model which looked really out of place in an expensive modern hotel (some rooms apparently have small flat screens...ours did not). The carpet in our room, while really nice, apparently doesn't wear well as it had pilling all over it and needs to be replaced...which is a shame as it looked really expensive (berber?). Our drinking glasses in the room were replaced with dirty glasses after we used them. Finally, our room was on the 2nd floor which allowed us to hear some street noise (not much since we never opened the windows). I would've preferred a higher floor room, but the hotel was sold out. All in all, if you're a young traveller (or young at heart) who likes modern, large, clean rooms (basically W Hotel) and doesn't want to risk it with some dump, this is your hotel (albeit a bit expensive). We always rely on Tablet Hotels and this fits their usual type of hotel to a "T."

Reviews.Title: “Nice stylish design hotel. Better than what we expected”
Reviews.Author: asnpko
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights to finish a weekly business trip in Turkey. We knew the location of the hotel was not within a touristic district but it is less than 15/20 min by taxi to the Blue Mosque, 5 mn to DolmabaÃ§e Palace, 15 mn from Ortakoy and 15 mn walk to Taksim Place. Rooms are stylish and quite big (we booked a corner room). Staff was nice (even if the restaurant staff do not speak perfectly English we managed to get what we needed) and Front desk was very helpful. Choices for breakfast are quite simple but sufficient. Just missing a few amenities in the bathroom (because of restriction from airlines) and as outside is quite noisy difficult to sleep with open windows.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel - good value for money”
Reviews.Author: stephanuk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bentley as part of a business trip to Istanbul in September 2007, which covered 3 hotels over one week (due to logistical circumstances). Having started my Istanbul stay at the Ciragan Kempinski I expected quite a step down, but I was very positively surprised. I got upgraded to a suite, as the hotel was completely full. This was much nicer than the stuffy room in the Kempinski - with a little kitchen, stereo system etc. The hotel is modern and stylish, the location is central (but much closer to 'modern' Istanbul, than to the main tourist sights). I didn't have any negative experiences with the staff like other people mention here. The breakfast is a little on the simple side.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a design hotel....”
Reviews.Author: gallwill
Reviews.Content: The Bentley is not quite a 'design hotel' compared to other european hotels. Generally it was ok but the staff were not the most helpful. On our first day we had no running water (due to maintance of the pipes.) We were not informed of this at all dispite being told that they apparently phoned. We argued that they should at least give us a discount especially for having to use bottled water from the minibar .....but they would have non of it. Acoustics betweens rooms are very poor. Location was generally ok but shown incorrectly in the 'Tablet Hotel's Website'.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish, shame about staff”
Reviews.Author: Sheilaontour
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated about 10 minutes walk from Taksim Square. The rooms are a great size and as with the rest of the hotel very stylish and fitted out well. Unfortunately the staff did not live up to expecations. Our mini bar was not refilled, and we are meaning bottle water here! The restaurant they suggested on the first night, was just average. We asked for help in booking boat trips, checking in online, finding specific restaurants (as recommended by Time Out), directions to specific sites and all were met with an attempt and then a shrug saying they could not help. This was a shame because it could all have been so go. They should take a leaf out of the service we experienced at our hotel in Barcelona (Omn) which was fantastic. Only on the last night did were we offered turn down service by a chap without any trolley etc, all very odd.

Reviews.Title: “A Classy Place”
Reviews.Author: richard_traveler
Reviews.Content: Istanbul, to me, was a noisy, chaotic, cluttered, crowded place... what the tourist books would call "bustling." I have a low tolerance for all this hub-bub. Which made the Bentley my oasis.I arrived from the airport by taxi via a wild ride and trudged inside to the lobby via revolving glass doors, and as soon as I stepped in a felt a sense of order and serenity. The check in process was fine, even though the clerk had limited english. The room was a nice surprise ... close to the spacious size of an American hotel, but classy in feel. The bed was low, the color scheme relaxing, and the most prominent feature was a framed mirror, about 7 feet tall by 4 foot wide, leaning against the wall -- not mounted, just leaning there. It added a massive, surreal presence. The bathroom (and everything else) was modern, the internet good and free, the air conditioning good. If I wanted to re-engage the chaos, all I had to do was open the window and look down upon a crowded narrow street with all the local color. The breakfast area was fine, all you'd need for a typical European breakfast. As to the staff, they were all men and not too friendly but helpful. They were very professional in an efficient sort of way, not sugar-coated nice as one sees so much in America. All in all, I was very pleased with the lodging and value for what I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Well designed, but souless”
Reviews.Author: Globaladventure
Reviews.Content: With the range of 'chain' hotels and three star tourist options on offer in Istanbul - I chose The Bentley in the hope that it would be a welcomed change. Although not a bad location - if you are looking for the main sights (Grand Bazaar, mosques etc...), it is not the best. I would say it is more of a business than leisure location. The traffic in Istanbul can be very bad and taxis to the sights did not add to the 'magic' of the vacation. The hotel certainly looks smart and has a good impression. The 'design' aspect is a little over exagerated. Rooms are pretty standard, but well laid out. There is a bar just off the Lobby. Service here was laid back to the point of non existent. This was the same in the restaurant (we only ate breakfast). When the staff were there, they were friendly. The hotel did not offer much else. I would say it is fine, if you are not demanding and just want a good room close to Taktsang Square. One final negative, were the protitutes outside the hotel late at night - but this seemed to be a city wide problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: rfedc
Reviews.Content: I had read all the reviews of the Bentley before making the booking so i was a little wary of the place. It was however very nice. i've stayed at the Ritz, the Four Seasons etc. This place is more like a W hotel. the staff was always helpful, very nice and pleasant. rooms were spacious - we had a one bedroom suite. the prices are good and overall i would definitely recommend the place. btw, the comments about the sewage smell - this isn't a bentley problem - its just they clear the water mains in this area it appears quite frequently. happened once during the 5 days i was there - it didn't impact anything.

Reviews.Title: “Beware to leave valuables in the room”
Reviews.Author: basilio
Reviews.Content: We went out for dinner the evening before we left, on our return an expensive Gucci belt had been stolen from inside one of the drawers. We reported this the day after, we never got an answer from the Top Management, but from the Sales Office who made us feel like if it was our own fault for leaving it in the drawer ( !) The fact that our bathroom had a sewage problem which caused a terrible smell throughout our stay and which was never fixed ( the housekeepers kept spraying air freshener ) added to make this a very unpleasant stay. One advise, if you must stay at The Bentley , DO NOT leave anything valuable in your room other than the safe.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherNorway
Reviews.Content: We heard about this hotel through friends we met in Alanya--- we weren't intending on going to Istanbul but after hearing their recommendation, we decided to check it out. The staff were very professional and helpful. We asked the concierge for advice on where to go for dinner one night, and he arranged reservations and a taxi for us at a wonderful restaurant on the Bosphorus, definitely one of the highlights of the trip! The hotel itself is in a good location and is very smart, we had a beautiful room and the breakfasts were delicious--- lots of choice and loved the fabulousTurkish coffee! Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Bentley Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Halaskargazi Cad. No. 75 | Harbiye, Istanbul 80220, Turkey
